title: Analysis of composite function part - a

content.description: Let f be a twice-differentiable function such that f(2)=5 and f(5)=2. Let g be the function given by g(x)=f(f(x)).
content.question: Explain why there must be a value c for 2 < c < 5 such that f'(c)=-1.

frqParts.text: Explain why there must be a value c for 2 < c < 5 such that f'(c)=-1.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
